name: TheAtlantic
text: Prominent Trump critics worry about what may await them between now and Inauguration Day, @PeterAtlantic reports. Will the president try to retaliate against them? https://t.co/s7l5JDzc5E

name: TheAtlantic
text: “I find haiku hard / But for you, I will try it / Expectations: low.” For The Friendship Files, @julieebeck talks with two friends who’ve sent each other a haiku every day during the pandemic: https://t.co/DeyFtsIKWd

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump’s performative intransigence may or may not hurt American democracy in the long run, but in the short run, it risks thousands of excess COVID-19 deaths, with the potential toll increasing the longer his tantrum continues," @conor64 writes: https://t.co/8d3yLXwaGh

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I fear that in the short term, Americans will encounter less rigorous and more polarizing journalism. In the long term, a dearth of ideological diversity risks consequences we cannot fully anticipate," @conor64 writes: https://t.co/QrrxfLG46g

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Even with a vaccine that’s fully vetted and ready to go, it will take many months for enough people to receive it to provide population-wide protection," @DrTomFrieden writes: https://t.co/rBUacM4ApH

name: TheAtlantic
text: For the photographer Amber N. Ford, the death of 12-year-old Tamir Rice was a breaking point, @DrAlliRich writes. Ford pored over his story, and others like it, then mined her community for found art. https://t.co/LHH7Pq8nMS

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: @mimbsy asked writers and editors from around our newsroom to share a nostalgic TV pick. https://t.co/Mc4r3zAYUA

name: TheAtlantic
text: Every president since Ronald Reagan has left a note for his successor in the Oval Office. @alextkalman on the importance of this small moment for the life of a democracy: https://t.co/6IgI0LK3Em

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Listen: On the latest episode of "Social Distance," the lead principal investigator of the Pfizer vaccine explain the news that it’s 90 percent effective.
https://t.co/jlKWKJfpyM

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The fruits of science can help defeat this pandemic only if society is working well enough to distribute them quickly and equitably," @TomBollyky writes. But past experience offers reasons for concern. https://t.co/9BrrKgpYoF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Why can't a girl inherit a dukedom? In Britain, there's a new frontier for feminism—the aristocracy. @helenlewis meets the campaigners trying to drag the peerage into the 21st century. https://t.co/o2bqw1WAj1

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: "This all made perfect sense in 1620, or even 1720. But it’s harder to understand in 2020, when Britain has had two female prime ministers, [and] 50 years of equal pay under the law." Definitely make time to read @helenlewis's latest in @TheAtlantic https://t.co/FW23nh81Zt

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "Your success now is our country's success. I am rooting hard for you." https://t.co/EYh1zKNj74

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @slaskow: It’s also a good time to read @amandamull on safety: we are bad at adjusting our thinking about this https://t.co/zZkqf7CAc9

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “What follows is a strange story, because it is about discrimination toward the privileged: feminism for aristocrats. It reveals a country trapped between tradition and modernity, between the Middle Ages and the 21st century.” https://t.co/M3AEd05hft

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: Reading Proust during the pandemic. A great essay from Oliver Munday: 
https://t.co/tzUuVZyjuZ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "[W]e are entering this dreadful period without the kind of leadership or preparation we need, and with baseline numbers that will make it difficult to avoid a dramatic rise in hospitalizations, deaths, and potential long-term effects on survivors." 
https://t.co/sibl8Si7JT

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @zeynep: Listen up, folks. There's much good news. The end of this pandemic may be near. But a very harsh winter is upon us. Like other viruses, this one seems sharply seasonal. People need to rethink everything and *hunker down*, now. It's so close. Don't risk it. https://t.co/ojvHuEmxYu https://t.co/3hQ0s0PfxI

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @helenlewis: Why can't a girl inherit a dukedom? In Britain, there's a new frontier for feminism—the aristocracy. I met the campaigners trying to drag the peerage into the 21st century (and got to pet a horse). https://t.co/MyvOoNfu3w

name: TheAtlantic
text: Mike Pondsmith created the tabletop series Cyberpunk in 1988. Now we seem to be living in the future Pondsmith envisioned—and Cyberpunk is the inspiration for a highly anticipated video game, Darryn King writes. https://t.co/S7Itds0493
